0: The main hall is crowded with company booths. Peer Observation: There is a red banner hanging on the east wall and a large potted plant near the center of the hall. YOUR TASK: Perform a factual merge of the two observations to create a single, unified log. Identify & De-duplicate: Identify all unique objects, attributes, and spatial relationships from both sources. If both sources describe the same object (e.g., "a building"), treat them as one. Reconcile & Enhance: If descriptions for the same object differ, merge the details. Use the most specific and complete information from both. Integrate & Spatialize: Combine the complete, de-duplicated set of facts into a single, spatially coherent paragraph. The goal is to describe a larger, combined area. OUTPUT RULES: Format: YOUR ENTIRE RESPONSE MUST BE ONLY THE FINAL SYNTHESIZED SUMMARY. Style: Single paragraph of plain text. No markdown, lists, or headings. Objectivity: Be literal, factual, and geometric. Length: Must not exceed 150 words.

Attendees are actively engaged in exchanging business cards, indicating a high level of interaction within the space.
